is a small village in the
mountains of
, in the Rhirhaia valley. It's just over 2000m above sea level and has a population of about 600 people. There is a small school for the children from the surrounding villages and a local mosque.
Open back trucks provides a 'bus' service to Ikkiss along the rutted tracks a couple of times a week from
and

. The roads however are very prone to damage due to flooding washing them away. Walking to Ikkiss from Imlil is a reasonable alternative. It's about 5 or 6 miles from Imlil over a mountain pass (about 4 hours walking none-stop)

The road/track only goes to Imlil over the pass, and not down the main valley (towards Asni). However, footpaths go between all the villages in the valley.
There is a rough track that goes part way into the village, but it's mainly just a collection of paths. On foot is the only way.
The green, cultivated, terraced fields all over the valley are amazing, as are the mountains.
Hiking is the main activity. Either from here, or from
hiking into the mountains is very easy.
There may be a very small 'convenience store' (aka someone's house that sold a few things), but it may not be open often, or very permanent.
There probably isn't any accommodation here. The nearest Refuge is in
. The Berbers are friendly people though, and if you're in a pickle, will find a bit of floor for you to sleep on (for a price).
The only road goes south, back towards Imlil. Paths go East to
and West down the valley towards
. It is possible to head West, then head over a pass further West (past the one for Imlil). From there a damp river crossing will get you onto the main road between
and
, where hitching back to
is easy.
